result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Somer Ann Herchenbach

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Defendant Somer Ann Herchenbach appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Somer Ann Herchenbach.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson is discussing the matter with the DA next Wednesday; requests a Prelim or status be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
If waiver, may be done by zoom.
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:27 AM Defendant Somer Ann Herchenbach appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Somer Ann Herchenbach.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Johnson waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands and agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: for Leave to File Additional Motions

Adjustment Number: 22A 002169,
Payable Number: 75427,
Receipt Number: 22R 003424,
Amount: $20.00
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:32 PM Defendant Somer Ann Herchenbach appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for PD appointment.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to get an Attorney.  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
